headline.main: MALTA SHIP ROUTE CALLED TOUGHEST; British Convoy Veteran Says Voyage Is More Perilous Than That to Murmansk FOE MET CLOSE TO HOME Commander Kimmins Depicts Mediterranean Battle That Cost the Carrier Eagle

lead_paragraph: The impossibility of sending allied merchant vessels into the Mediterranean except with the most powerful escort and the peril involved in getting through to Malta even strong convoys were outlined yesterday by Commander Anthony Kimmins of the Royal Navy, who has participated in convoy battles on the routes to Murmansk, Russia, as well as Malta.
abstract: Brit Comdr Kimmins describes perils of Malta convoy route

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST FRONT
